Job Posting:175128 - Position: W26 Game Data Analyst Co-op 175128 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/12/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 11/05/2025 03:45 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Kabam Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Game Data Analyst Co-op 175128 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 4 months In-Person CAD 0.0 per hour for 40 Major List $26 - $28 per hour At Kabam, we're constantly raising the bar of excellence in free- to-play gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture, and a drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come inâ€¦ We're looking for a Game Data Analyst Co-op to join our team! Reporting to the Senior Game Data Analyst for Marvel Contest of Champions, you'll gain immersive, hands-on experience analyzing the live performance, feature performance, and player behavior of one of Marvel's most popular mobile games. This role demands a scientific, results-driven approach to transform large datasets into actionable strategic insights. If you're passionate about data, games, and applying a rigorous analytical approach to inform strategy, we want to hear from you! In this role, you can expect to: Insight Generation & Partnership (Cross-functional Impact) - Collaborate closely with Product, Design and Marketing teams to translate their business objectives into measurable data questions - Conduct hands-on exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends, anomalies, and key drivers behind in-game metrics. - Present findings and insights clearly and concisely to stakeholders - Review reporting processes and suggest enhancements to resolve inefficiencies. Data Extraction and Preparation (Foundational Skills) - Utilize SQL querying, extracting and manipulating complex datasets from production and analytical data warehouses and other applicable sources. - Assist in refining and optimizing existing data queries to improve efficiency and accuracy. Reporting and Visualization (Stakeholder Support) - Maintain and ensure accuracy of existing analytical dashboards (potentially in Tableau, Looker, Power BI) tailored to various team needs within the organization. - Develop ad-hoc reports quickly to address immediate, high priority business questions from leadership. - Propose and implement enhancement to current reporting processes to resolve inefficiencies and increase adoptions - Ensure that dashboards and reports are up-to-date and accurate. Product Feature Analysis and Optimization (Direct Impact) - Execute post-launch analysis on newly released in-game features, events, or products. - Measure feature success against pre-defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and recommend data-backed optimization paths. Job Requirements Currently enrolled in a qualifying Co-Ops program, preferably within a STEM discipline (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering) Key Skills - SQL: Practical experience writing queries for data extraction and manipulation - Data Presentation: Demonstrated ability to synthesize complex analytical results into clear, concise and visually effective presentation. - Gaming Acumen: Familiarity with general game design concepts and monetization principles in the mobile F2P (Free-to- Play) space. - BI Tools: Exposure to visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI is a bonus Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Address Cover Letter to Kabam Hiring Team Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Kabam - Game Data Analyst Co-op Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
